Learn how to use this ID for signing your apps and packages, and how Gatekeeper uses these signatures to verify that a downloaded app is not known malware and that it hasn't been tampered with.

item.title: 703 - Core Bluetooth 101
item.itunes:subtitle: The CoreBluetooth framework lets your iOS applications communicate with Bluetooth Low Energy devices over a personal area network (PAN). Learn about the Bluetooth LE technology and the APIs we provide for designing apps that connect to a Bluetooth LE peripheral and read, write, and request notification of changes to the characteristics of the peripheral.
item.itunes:summary: The CoreBluetooth framework lets your iOS applications communicate with Bluetooth Low Energy devices over a personal area network (PAN). Learn about the Bluetooth LE technology and the APIs we provide for designing apps that connect to a Bluetooth LE peripheral and read, write, and request notification of changes to the characteristics of the peripheral.

item.title: 704 - The Security Framework
item.itunes:subtitle: This session covers the Security framework technologies on both OS X and iOS. Learn about the Keychain, Secure Transport, certificate evaluation, crypto, and how apps can utilize these technologies.
item.itunes:summary: This session covers the Security framework technologies on both OS X and iOS. Learn about the Keychain, Secure Transport, certificate evaluation, crypto, and how apps can utilize these technologies.

item.title: 705 - Advanced Core Bluetooth
item.itunes:subtitle: In addition to providing services to iOS devices, Bluetooth LE peripherals can also use services provided by iOS devices. Learn how to advertise Bluetooth LE services in your iOS apps.
item.itunes:summary: In addition to providing services to iOS devices, Bluetooth LE peripherals can also use services provided by iOS devices. Learn how to advertise Bluetooth LE services in your iOS apps.

item.title: 706 - Networking Best Practices
item.itunes:subtitle: iOS and OS X both provide a number of abstractions to simplify and demystify networking and its inherent complexity. This session covers these abstractions in detail—from a TCP connection to NSURLConnection—and explains best design practices to tune for performance and power.
item.itunes:summary: iOS and OS X both provide a number of abstractions to simplify and demystify networking and its inherent complexity. This session covers these abstractions in detail—from a TCP connection to NSURLConnection—and explains best design practices to tune for performance and power.

item.title: 707 - Simplify Networking with Bonjour
item.itunes:subtitle: Learn how your network applications and services on iOS, OS X and other platforms can use Bonjour to simplify your user experience. Bonjour, also known as zero-configuration networking, is used by a wide range of products and applications for streamlined and reliable networking to easily publish, discover, and resolve network services.
item.itunes:summary: Learn how your network applications and services on iOS, OS X and other platforms can use Bonjour to simplify your user experience. Bonjour, also known as zero-configuration networking, is used by a wide range of products and applications for streamlined and reliable networking to easily publish, discover, and resolve network services.

item.title: 708 - The Accelerate Framework
item.itunes:subtitle: The Accelerate framework contains signal and image processing, matrix and linear algebra computation, and now an optimized array-based math library for iOS. Find out how you can use the Accelerate framework to achieve dramatic improvements in performance and energy consumption.
item.itunes:summary: The Accelerate framework contains signal and image processing, matrix and linear algebra computation, and now an optimized array-based math library for iOS. Find out how you can use the Accelerate framework to achieve dramatic improvements in performance and energy consumption.

item.title: 709 - What's New In The Filesystem
item.itunes:subtitle: Learn about recent changes to the OS X filesystem and find out what you need to know about FileVault 2, CoreStorage, extended attributes, and ExFAT. Hear about new APIs as well as which APIs are deprecated and understand how to use the filesystem APIs to optimize your code.
item.itunes:summary: Learn about recent changes to the OS X filesystem and find out what you need to know about FileVault 2, CoreStorage, extended attributes, and ExFAT. Hear about new APIs as well as which APIs are deprecated and understand how to use the filesystem APIs to optimize your code.

item.title: 710 - Privacy Support in iOS and OS X
item.itunes:subtitle: Learn about new iOS and OS X privacy features and get details on new and updated APIs. Hear best practices for delivering great features and respecting your customers' privacy.
item.itunes:summary: Learn about new iOS and OS X privacy features and get details on new and updated APIs. Hear best practices for delivering great features and respecting your customers' privacy.

item.title: 711 - Power Management
item.itunes:subtitle: Mountain Lion includes several new power management behaviors that may affect the efficiency of your apps. Learn how to optimize your code for power use, how your code can influence system behavior, how to debug sleep/wake issues, and use existing tools to spot energy leaks.
item.itunes:summary: Mountain Lion includes several new power management behaviors that may affect the efficiency of your apps. Learn how to optimize your code for power use, how your code can influence system behavior, how to debug sleep/wake issues, and use existing tools to spot energy leaks.

item.title: 712 - Asynchronous Design Patterns with Blocks, GCD, and XPC
item.itunes:subtitle: Blocks, Grand Central Dispatch, and XPC form a powerful foundation for asynchronous processing and communication in your app. Dive into the basics around blocks, GCD, and XPC and learn about their improved integration with ARC. Discover the common design patterns used when writing asynchronous code to offload work from your main thread, perform IO in the background or send messages to other processes, and how to apply these same patterns to your own code.
item.itunes:summary: Blocks, Grand Central Dispatch, and XPC form a powerful foundation for asynchronous processing and communication in your app. Dive into the basics around blocks, GCD, and XPC and learn about their improved integration with ARC. Discover the common design patterns used when writing asynchronous code to offload work from your main thread, perform IO in the background or send messages to other processes, and how to apply these same patterns to your own code.

item.title: 714 - Protecting the User's Data
item.itunes:subtitle: Learn about "real world" threats to users' data on OS X and iOS. See practical demonstrations of how users' data can be attacked both on the device and over the network, and find out how to defend against these threats in your app.
item.itunes:summary: Learn about "real world" threats to users' data on OS X and iOS. See practical demonstrations of how users' data can be attacked both on the device and over the network, and find out how to defend against these threats in your app.
